Module othellobot
Package othellobot

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • othellobot.Player
  • public class Player
extends Object
    The Player class represents a player in the Othello game. Heuristics will be used in the methods to analyze the board and calculate next moves.
    Since:
    2019-08-29
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Austin Howard

      Method for choosing a move from an ArrayList of possible moves.

      Method to find all possible moves for a player by iterating through all empty spaces and all directions for each empty space to check for move validity.
      String formatMove​(int[] move, Player player)
      Format the move into a string for standard output.

      Getter method for the String representing the player's color.

    • Method Detail

      • receiveInput

        public void receiveInput​(String input)
        Method to receive input for which color to initialize as.
        Parameters:
        input - either "I W" to initialize as WHITE or "I B" to initialize as BLACK.

      • sendMove

        public String sendMove​(String move)
        Method to send a formatted move.
        Parameters:
        move -
        Returns:
        move

      • findPossibleMoves

        public ArrayList<Integer> findPossibleMoves​(Board board,
                                            Player player)
        Method to find all possible moves for a player by iterating through all empty spaces and all directions for each empty space to check for move validity.
        Parameters:
        board - the game board.
        player - the player for which to find possible moves.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with indexes that represent possible moves.

      • chooseMove

        public int[] chooseMove​(ArrayList<Integer> moveList)
        Method for choosing a move from an ArrayList of possible moves. Currently just picks the first available move.
        Parameters:
        moveList - ArrayList of possible moves.
        Returns:
        integer list for a move [columnNumber,rowNumber]

      • formatMove

        public String formatMove​(int[] move,
                         Player player)
        Format the move into a string for standard output.
        Parameters:
        move - integer list of the move [columnNumber,rowNumber].
        player - player making the move.
        Returns:
        formatted string.

      • getColorInt

        public int getColorInt()
        Getter method to get the integer associated with the player's color.
        Returns:
        color integer.

      • setColorInt

        public void setColorInt​(int colorInt)
        Setter method for the integer associated with the player's color.
        Parameters:
        colorInt - color integer.

      • getColor

        public String getColor()
        Getter method for the String representing the player's color.
